content: Great app. It works very well. My only complaint. After getting the auth configured. Montage view made my monitors so small I had to the plus sign a 100 to size them appropriately. I only had to do it once.

It's a good app but I wish there was legacy support for older ZM versions. Would give it 5/5 if I could still use it, but I'm locked in to ZM 1.30.4 without doing a ton of work. Be careful enabling automatic updates with this app if you can't keep ZM updated.
We good
replyContent: Peter, hard to help if you don't post an issue (and not sure if you've read the FAQ). 1. Try clearing your zmNinja cache (Menu->Clear Cache) 2. See FAQ https://zmninja.readthedocs.io/en/latest/guides/FAQ.html#how-to-report-errors

content: This is truly an awesome app, and works great on my Samsung Galaxy S10. Every time I ran into issues, all I had to do is follow the detailed help instructions, and eventually everything always works. My only reason to give 4 stars is that it doesn't work on several tablets I tried (mostly Samsung). I wanted to hang a couple of tablets around the house as camera monitors, but couldn't use ZmN for that. If you could add this support - that would be truly great.

Comprehensive well laid out and integrates really well with Zoneminder server. I run Zoneminder in an RPi4 4gb currently with 2 IP cameras, it took a while to set up as I tried a few of the standard RPi OS which only allowed ZM to work with one camera. I settled on Ubuntu server 20.04 which works spot on.
replyContent: Thanks Steve - glad you liked the app! FYI, I've also release the desktop version of the app that supports arm64 for the rPI

content: Works awesome, better than the zoneminder web interface!
replyContent: Thanks Steve!

content: Good app, but bit harsh that an app upgrade release means you have to upgrade the backend or lose functionality. A breaking change push would have been good, so we could switch off auto updates!
replyContent: I've actually advertised this for over a month (2-3 months maybe) - my guess is most people don't track my release updates on medium or ZM forums. What is a breaking change push? I am happy to try it out the next time.

content: 🤯 Awesome app! Super intuitive user interface with lots of featured
replyContent: Thanks Rainer. Glad you like the app!

content: Api error nothing i do would get around it
replyContent: That's quite a broad statement. I don't know what you tried, and you never reached out for help. https://zmninja.readthedocs.io/en/latest/guides/FAQ.html#things-you-should-own-up-to and other sections in the FAQ are a good start. If you are interested in resolution, lets start by creating a github issue with logs.

content: Not as good as the iPad version. On the iPad I can zoom through a video by dragging my finger along the progress bar, a 10 minute video can be reviewed in 10 seconds. The android version loads the video slower and does not fast forward as well as the iPad, I have to drag my finger very slowly across the progress bar otherwise it does not update.
replyContent: Both the app (iOS and Android) use the native video players of each platform (assuming you are using mp4)- zmNinja doesn't really do anything different for each platform. I wonder if your issues are related to the Android version you are on? If it isn't, please reach out via github or email and we can debug.

content: Works ok from what I was able to test of it. But zone minder isn't working the best. If I get it working so it can move the camera. I will likely buy it again
replyContent: Thanks for your review Ryan - hope you get ZM to where you need it to be.

content: Awesome work sir!
replyContent: Thanks Jason :)

content: Brilliant app. Thanks for making it. To be able to view the events anywhere in the world is a must have. At first I had API error on admin account but I created a new user with full admin credentials and it works brilliant. Thanks again.
replyContent: Glad you like the app Craig!

content: Absolutely fantastic, well made, exposes plenty of features, great work.

content: Excellent

content: Live view is broken. Viewing events works fine but viewing monitors live just shows the can't load image icon. It works fine in the zoneminder web ui

content: This has been a great app so far, feature rich and nice to configure. Working on the event server component at the moment to get the picture push notifications working. Installed on the phone last night and discovered today that there's also a great desktop counterpart as well available for free which is a fantastic value adder and a great incentive on the part of the developer. Many thanks for your work on this app, it's a pleasure to use and does exactly what I need it to.
replyContent: Thanks Tony! Glad you've found the ES useful as well.

content: Love the app, I think author did an awesome job developing it and maintaining. Would love to see a "skip forward" button for video playback. My cameras are constantly recording (mocord) in 10 minute clips, when camera detects a motion it marks it in red on timeline of the video. It is difficult to drag the playback dot to exactly the time before the motion was detected. A skip forward 10seconds button would be awesome (kind of like YouTube or netflix does, click it to go forward/back 10sec)
replyContent: Glad you like the app, Dennis. Cool idea - would you mind creating a github issue? I can track it.

content: Well worth the money
replyContent: Thanks Brandon!

content: Wow, really makes zoneminder make sense!
replyContent: Hah! Indeed - glad you like it. Thanks Matthew.

content: Nice software for the function, may need some search to setup right. The path to cgi-bin setting need to be server/cgi-bin for the monitor live view to work.
replyContent:
Thanks for writing in Guang. Unfortunately, there is no way to properly test if cgi-bin works, so its a best guess. I'll give it more thought.
 The clear API cache part is not needed to view events - events are not cached. It might be that you added monitors after the cache and they were not picked up, which is why you needed to clear the cache.

content: It is a great app if I was broadcasting over the net and wanted a phone portal. The fact is that when I connect to my private security network which is not connected to the internet to this phone. I must turn off my data also. If I am going to turn off my data to use the app then there are not enough reasons why I would need your app. It is robust, and nicely scalable but nothing I need at the present. I wanted to at least check it out. Nicely done.
replyContent: Thanks for your comments and for taking time to pen your thoughts. I'm not sure I understand the concern about having to turn off data. zmNinja works fine inside a LAN as well without internet. If you have other concerns that inhibit your usage of the app, feel free to drop an email to pliablepixels@gmaill.com or create a Github issue thx.

content: Excellent app. Really impressed with the work the developer has put into it and appreciate how active they are with support. I bought this app months ago and it didn't work to start with. Read a few of the developers comments and found I had a misconfiguration on my server. Fixed it, and all working.
replyContent: Thanks Andrewv - always good to see folks taking time to also leave positive reviews :-) If you ever need more help, please feel free to ping me via Github/slack/email

content: Works perfectly! When it is not working, API must be enabled first.
replyContent: Thanks Pedro!

content: Needs client certificate (mutual TLS) support. No good to me currently.
replyContent: Please feel free to refund the app, or send me the order ID to refund. Client certificates are not supported (and no plans due to platform limitations). This is a long reported issue on zmNinja's GitHub page.

content: Works great with my zoneminder docker image.
replyContent: Thanks Mier!

content: Edit: added a star, this would be a 5 star app but ZM is not great and doesn't work well. I can't give 5 stars as it would encourage people to use ZM. App functions well but ZM itself is horrible and does not work with modern cctv due to ridiculously inefficient design... that's why this is 3 stars.
replyContent: Thanks for your review. zmNinja is not developed by the core ZM developers, so downrating the app because the server side is bad would likely make more sense if they were developed by the same folks.

content: Functions exactly like it does on the desktop. Fantastic. Wish it would automatically switch to whichever camera has an alert while cycling though cameras, but otherwise is great. Easily worth twice the price, I would gladly pay $ 10 bucks without thinking twice about it.
replyContent: Thanks Mike! Appreciate the input. The alarm idea is interesting. If you'd like please fit in a feature request at https://github.com/pliablepixels/zmNinja/issues

content: After setting up and enabling Event Server, Montage view is frequently unable to load camera previews. I have to either leave the app, or switch to another section and then return to Montage view for the images to actually appear. I'm also getting notifications for events on a camera that I have "report events" disabled on....
replyContent:
1. Montage view - a bug was reported for android devices - if you directly start in montage view, it often doesn't load monitors. But if you navigate to the montage view from another view, it works. This was fixed and will be part of the next release
2. Make sure your changes were recorded in the ES tokens.txt file. See FAQ.

content: the app worked well on zm ver1.32, but it doesn't play video ( both live and recorded) since I upgraded to ver 1.35! web and desktop pro application play video normally. hope can receive the new version of this app with this bug fix very soon. thanks for Pliable Pixels' info. It is a bit challenge to find the error on my ZM ver1.35. No error logged on zmNinja and zm neither. Finally I found the cgi-bin error logged on Apache2 log. Now the app runs like a charm!
replyContent: There is nothing wrong with the app. Lots of people regularly use it with 1.34 (1.35  doesn’t exist). Check your debug logs and create an issue.

content: Great app and great developer thanks a lot
replyContent: Thank you Owen!

content: Great app, great support
replyContent: Thanks Dennis!

content: Same experience across devices. While zone minder itself was a bit of a learning curve coming from blue iris zmninja worked as it should out of the box and has a similar experience whether on desktop or mobile. I did notice a small quirk that on zm 1.34.1 the wizard would complain about the api however when manually inserted it worked fine (did not see this with zm1.32)
replyContent: Hi Joshie, thanks for your review! Curious - what was the API url that worked when entered manually?

content: Warning about not working on latest Android version. Buttons in the help menu do nothing at all. Doesn't appear to have any PTZ or other controls that the web interface would have. Can't view captured footage from the server as Event list says error retrieving 90% of the time. Works for the most part otherwise to view monitors and such but lots of room for further development.
replyContent: 1. Help - edit: fixed in 1.3.087 . 2. zmNinja does support PTZ. Live View->floating button->control 3. Event list doesn't work 90% of time - look at logs. You are the first person to say this 4. improvement - happy to improve if I get non-ambiguous comments - please create a GitHub issue

content: Now that you can have a nice clean display of a monitor it's an excellent app for monitoring Zoneminder from a phone.
replyContent: Stuart, glad you like the app. Good feedback. I just released 1.3.079 - you should now be able to tap the screen once to hide those controls (and tap to bring it back). I'm not going to make it persistent though - in other words, you'll always have to tap once. I think several users will panic if the screen showed up with no controls at the start.

content: Works but complains you need to enable "AUTH_HASH_LOGINS" on startup.  Not sure why...tried the desktop version first to test and it worked fine as is.  Bit expensive for a basic viewer but unfortunately it seems ZmView has been discontinued so this is the only alternative I could find.
replyContent: Well, you do need it on. https://github.com/pliablepixels/zmNinja/wiki/FAQ#i-suddently-see-an-error-message-saying-i-need-to-enable-zm_auth_hash_logins-this-wasnt-there-before

content: Everything works, but sometimes pay notification just doesn't work, and will be back to normal after a while, not sure how to configure. another issue is, there is no time settings for push notification. I am on Android 8.
replyContent: Do you mean push notification? You'll have to provide much more details with logs etc for me to help. Please create a detailed report on https://github.com/pliablepixels/zmeventserver/ so I can help. Also, many people misunderstand when push notifications are sent - see https://github.com/pliablepixels/zmeventserver/issues/72#issuecomment-451570215

content: Works, but it's not that much better than the web UI. Reviewing motion detected material works better on web UI since it auto-plays from event to event whereas in here you have to keep swiping to go from one event to the next. The brilliant timeline feature is also nicer on web UI. Maybe this will improve in future versions. edit: On the other hand, web UI doesn't resume gapless play at 2x rate but instead always resets to 1x. If you can implement both that would be great! Faster than 2x playback could be handy as well.
replyContent: Yup, I'll get around to adding gapless playback for video. It already exists for jpegs (i.e. keeps progressing). Thanks for your comments. If the Web UI works for you as well on mobile, then I agree, you don't need zmNinja

content:
Some time ago, I set up ZM in a Docker container in a Digital Ocean Droplet 
to monitor cameras at properties in a couple different states. These sites 
are all connected via OpenVPN - I'm not wasting my time trying to secure ZM 
with TLS an and so on. Nor am I willing to waste my time with dealing with 
mysql, php, and managing versions and changes - hence using a publicly 
available Docker container. My phones also automatically connect to the VPN 
so everything is secure and available from anywhere. Just discovered this 
app. It immediately connected to my ZM Docker setup without any 
configuration at all. Nothing to it. Why didn't I Discovery this earlier...
replyContent: Thanks Travis - glad you like the app!

content:
I'm not sure what others are complaining about. If you're using Zoneminder

If you put in an internal IP and expect to connect to it while on mobile 
data, you're gonna have a bad day.

content: The best zone minder app for android. The API wasn't too tricky to set up for an experienced person. Well worth the cash.

content: I don't know what is going on, I put in the correct information, and things work in the browser, except the app keeps freezing. .... update...I just figured it out, it was an issue with mod_rewrite not being set correctly in ZM, however there is still a bug in the app, cause it was acting as if everything was fine, with green on everything, but it was causeing the app to freeze and I had to clear out all the settings in the app and try again.
replyContent: Hi,Its hard for the app to gauge if ZM is setup correctly. If ZM is not set up correctly, with APIs functioning, the app may misbehave. Making sure ZM & APIs work correctly is a core requirement for the app. In the next version, I am going to put a message on that screen - too many people don't configure ZM correctly & think its an app problem.

content: A thoroughly professional app and by far the best way to access your Zoneminder server.  As if that weren't enough there's now also a version for Windows!  If only all apps were up to this quality, worth every penny.  Keep up the great work!
replyContent: Thank you - glad you like the app!

content: This is a great addition after you take the time to setup your Zoneminder installation correctly.  I have this installed on multiple Android devices and also use the Desktop version.  Great way to add a more user friendly interface.  Worth every penny; one of a few installed apps that is actually useful.
replyContent: Thanks Chad - appreciate your comments!

content: I never left a review before, or purchased an app before, but this app is worth it! I just spent the last 4 days setting up the surveillance system at our house and gosh zoneminder is great, but not easy to configure! Even the API which this app needs is complicated to get going, but nothing the developer can help with. All I can say, is don't give up on the process, it's worth it in the end! I'm so pleased with the whole system now and this app puts a nice finish on the security system! Thank you!
replyContent: Appreciate your comments Samuel! If you have time, can you shoot me an email with what problems you faced with the app after you had a proper ZM install+API working? I'll try and streamline those issues. pliablepixels@gmail. thx

content: I seldom buy apps, but I just configured a ZoneMinder server and this appears to be by far and away best means of accessing it. Solid work by the dev. Thanks!

content: zmNinja sets up without a hitch, works great, and,  along with Zoneminder, does everything I've ever wanted in a surveillance system.  'Nuff said.
replyContent: Appreciate your comments Dave! Thanks

content: Took a while to get running, through no fault of the zmNinja author. If your zoneminder configuration isn't just right, the API access won't work, and it's definitely an "expert" task to get it updated/upgraded/repaired to make it work.  I love the application, it's a thing of beauty layered on top of an extremely complex (and sometimes finicky) application (zoneminder.)  I sort of pity the author, because the complexity is really outside his control.
replyContent: Thanks Kevin - and thanks for the last sentence - you are absolutely correct. I find a lot of people install zmNinja without setting up ZM API correctly - something I can't control at all! To make things worse, I need to 'screen scrape' ZM at times to know if APIs are behaving correctly, which is a pain and also unpredictable!

content: A terrible trend with pay software on Android...  After you buy the software either a lack of support or competent coders leaves you with a horribly broken app.  On my Nexus 6 it's so busted menus don't work, gets stuck after connection and can't pull monitor feeds or anything.  Bad hat...
replyContent: An equally terrible trend is the buyer complains before attempting to contact. Given you never bothered contacting the developer and have likely not configured your ZM or the app properly, its best you just ask for a refund. If you are out of the refund time, shoot me an email with your order ID and I'll refund.

content: Thanks for the feedback, changed to 5 stars for now in anticipation for an update. a) Awesome. b) Seemingly very cumbersome to do when one doesn't even know which one is the culprit.  c) No need. OLD EDIT:The READ_PHONE_STATE is the permission I meant, which translates to "read phone state and identity" in the app store, which can access a lot of private information. And I did send an email, got the response that a library needed them - which is worse because I have no way of vetting a library I don't know.
replyContent:
Edited response (google forces a 350 char limit in response)
- I just released 1.2.27 which should fix the READ_PHONE_STATE permission that crept back in.

content: I've used ZoneMinder for years and I honestly think this may be the best thing that's happened in the ZoneMinder world in a long time.  ZoneMinder is awesome by itself but ZMNinja is the icing on the cake.  I'm using it with multiple servers, one with 16 cameras and another with 4.  Since installing and configuring ZMNinja, I haven't had a single crash or problem with it.  Everything I've tried has just worked.  I was overwhelmed by the features available in the app.  Keep up the excellent work Pliable Pixels!  This is now my top favorite app!  If there's one thing I'm confused on it's switching between multiple servers.  So far I've only been able to do that by going to Settings, clicking the little down arrow, selecting the second server and hitting "Save" again.  Have I missed something incredibly simple or is that indeed the only way to change servers?
replyContent: Hi there - first thanks for the appreciation - yes, thats the only way - you don't have to click on save though, it auto switches. So its 3 taps to change a server.

content: Can you have it cache the authentication or something so that flipping back and forth to the app is faster? I typically check ZM just for quick confirmations of cams, it takes longer with ZMninja than say, ipcamviewer or just leaving the browser open on device.
replyContent: Hi Tyler, the problem is if you don't re-auth and your IP changes or ZM's PHP timeout expires, you'll start seeing blank images and ZM doesn't give any indication of that to apps

content: The developer of this application has provided excellent support and shown real interest in resolving and improving the application.  After some back and forth and digging I found issues in both zmNinja's configuration and the installation of Zoneminder.   I'm bumping my review up to 4 stars based on the nice UI, it working, and being way better than all the other Zoneminder apps.  --- original review --  Auto config seems to work okay but the rest of the app just doesn't work for me. Serious UI glitches occur after initial setup, the UI gets nested within itself.  Closing the application and restarting  it does not seem to solve it either.  It gets stuck at the authenticating step which makes me wonder if the auto config worked at all.  This app has promise but I'm going to be seeking a refund.
replyContent: If you have problems, by all means refund. If you face problems refunding, shoot me an email and I'll refund. I'd love to know more  - especially your comment on UI getting nested. Would love some details and screenshots, if you have time - pliablepixels@gmail . Note that desktop version is free - give it a go goo.gl/OHGA04

content: Eccellent! I would be much happier if the app could also connect without have to setup a SSL cerificate on the phone.
replyContent:
Thanks Massimo. I'm reluctant to remove that requirement - if you are generating a self signed cert and I remove the check, it basically eliminates the concept of trusting that cert. Please see https://cordova.apache.org/docs/en/4.0.0/guide/appdev/security/#link-self-signed-certificates

Update: The next version will not require a SSL cert install

content: Works great. Has almost all of the features you'd expect in the webui, and then some.  Rated 4 stars instead of 5 ONLY because you can't see the live feed.  I've set it to update once per second.  If the app enabled live streaming (or I find a config option for it) I'll update to 5 stars!  Totally worth the price, for the peace of mind.  EDIT: Turns out, the issue wasn't with the app, or ZM setup.  I was having issues with the ISP, and what I thought were 1 or 2 second stills, were actually just high latency in streaming the images. which appeared to be still frames.   Rating moved to 5 stars! (and thanks for the quick feedback)
replyContent: Hello Jeff, zmNinja absolutely supports live streaming - both in montage view and monitor view. Make sure live streaming works in ZoneMinder - if it doesn't work in ZM, it won't work in zmNinja. If it works in ZM but not in zmNinja that means you have the cgi-path set incorrectly in zmNinja. See https://github.com/pliablepixels/zmNinja/wiki/FAQ
